intro: Marlimorimia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian marlimorimia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
